intro: Polythecium, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellow flowers that bloom in composite heads, which are made up of many small florets. The plant has a branched stem and is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are aromatic and have a slightly bitter taste, which has led to its use in traditional herbal remedies. The botanical features of Polythecium make it an important species in ecological studies and horticulture.
